intro: Calibrachoa sellowiana, commonly known as the weeping calibrachoa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, and white. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often used in hanging baskets or containers due to its cascading appearance. Calibrachoa sellowiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to bloom profusely throughout the growing season.
